meanings.definition: The act of digesting food again.
meanings.sent1: After eating, some animals have redigestions to break down their food further.
meanings.sent2: The redigestions of the food in the cow's stomach help extract all the nutrients.
meanings.sent3: The chef's redigestions of the recipe led to a delicious new dish.
meanings.sent4: Her redigestions of the textbook material helped her ace the exam.
meanings.sent5: The redigestions of the meal in his stomach made him feel full and satisfied.

meanings.definition: The process of reprocessing information or ideas.
meanings.sent1: Students often benefit from redigestions of the lesson to fully understand the topic.
meanings.sent2: The redigestions of the data allowed the researchers to uncover new insights.
meanings.sent3: His redigestions of the story helped him see it from a different perspective.
meanings.sent4: The redigestions of the facts led to a clearer understanding of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The redigestions of the instructions helped him complete the task successfully.

meanings.definition: The repetition of a process or action.
meanings.sent1: The redigestions of the song on the radio annoyed some listeners.
meanings.sent2: The redigestions of the exercise routine kept her fit and healthy.
meanings.sent3: His redigestions of the joke made everyone laugh even harder.
meanings.sent4: The redigestions of the meeting agenda ensured nothing was missed.
meanings.sent5: The redigestions of the game rules clarified any confusion among the players.
